intro: Herpysma longicaulis, commonly known as the long-stemmed herb, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its elongated, slender stems that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers during the late spring and early summer months. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, providing a distinctive appearance. Herpysma longicaulis is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
